Batman.Action: Silently lands on the roof using a bat glider, ensuring no one is with him before proceeding.
Uses a specialized device to discreetly shoot a dart into the roof and place a listening device.
Listens carefully through an earphone to filtered voices below, gathering intelligence.
Crashes through the window quickly, disarming multiple armed goons in rapid succession, uses precise and effective combat moves to subdue attackers.
Not present or intervening in this scene; unable to stop Phantasm or protect Chuckie.
Demonstrates careful stalking and pursuit of target, showing patience and strategic positioning (implied by Phantasm's tracking of Chuckie).
Allows target (Chuckie) to momentarily escape in a car, failing to intercept or stop him despite close proximity.
Quickly shoots his grappling hook to escape or pursue Phantasm upon noticing him.
Climbs over a wall and looks around after grappling hook ascent, demonstrating physical agility and situational awareness.
Looks puzzled and alone after Phantasm disappears, indicating momentary confusion or setback.
Organizes a get-together at his mansion for friends and acquaintances.
Maintains a stonefaced demeanor after being publicly humiliated and having a drink thrown in his face.
Leaves the party abruptly after the insult, without confrontation or displaying anger.
Maintains composure and remains stonefaced after having a drink thrown in his face at a social gathering.
Responds wryly to Reeves's teasing but avoids getting into an argument, shows restraint.
Jabs the handkerchief down Reeves’s breast pocket in a dismissive manner and walks away.
Withdraws to the study to be alone, reflecting somberly on his parents, showing vulnerability and introspection.
Refuses to engage in Reeves's teasing and walks away confidently, showing control and composure in social interaction.
Retreats to the study to be alone and reflect on his feelings triggered by Reeves's comments.
Places flowers on his parents' grave in a solemn moment.
Politely engages with Andrea, asking gently who she is talking to.
Appears uncertain and somewhat awkward in social interaction, but does not respond coldly.
Bruce exhibits uncertainty and awkwardness in social interaction when he misunderstands Andrea's talking to her mother's grave.
Bruce shows careful observation and curiosity by glancing around to understand the situation before responding.
Keeps a secret vow made to his parents and has kept it so far.
Engages thoughtfully and listens carefully during conversation with Andrea, showing emotional intelligence.
Does not reveal details about his vow and remains mysterious and controlled in social interaction.
Looks anxiously before intervening, prepares to stop burglars and help night guard.
Young Bruce prepares to intervene in a burglary, checks surroundings carefully, puts on a mask, and readies rope to act.
Dramatically intervenes to stop burglars, commands them to surrender without immediate violence.
Uses intimidation and a threatening tone to control the situation.
Uses physical force to quickly disable burglars threatening him.
Reactively disarms two armed burglars with precision using throwing stars and quick defensive maneuvers.
Uses physical combat skills effectively to incapacitate multiple attackers in close quarters.
Maintains composure and situational awareness when surrounded by multiple threats.
Subdues multiple attackers with skilled, non-lethal force, focusing on incapacitation rather than harm.
Stays alert and cautious during a dangerous confrontation, prioritizing safety over aggression.
Effectively disarms and incapacitates multiple attackers using precise martial arts moves, showing agility and tactical thinking.
Quickly recognizes imminent danger from gunfire and promptly takes cover behind a dumpster, avoiding bullets.
Initially looks puzzled at the guard's gesture but rapidly understands and adjusts his focus toward the new threat.
Looks toward the guard apologetically before taking action.
Runs at full speed, dodges obstacles, leaps to grab a moving truck to stop it.
Dangles from the truck and uses all his strength to pull himself in despite heavy obstacles (falling boxes, jewelry).
Fails to anticipate the refrigerators falling from the back of the truck, which strike him and throw him from the vehicle.
Uses star-shaped projectiles to disable the cab and stop the attacker driving it, risking his own safety.
Shows relief after a dangerous situation, indicating vulnerability and sincerity.
Practices martial arts diligently and explains his motivation to strike fear, showing seriousness and focus but impersonal intent.
Responds politely to Alfred's concern and visitor's arrival, indicating respectful and friendly behavior.
Hangs on the grill of a semi truck that is skidding and coming to a halt inches from a building, narrowly avoiding injury.
Practices jujitsu moves while recovering from injuries, showing discipline and skill development.
Acknowledges that his current approach failed to instill fear early enough, showing self-awareness and willingness to improve.
Maintains balance and recovers quickly after almost losing balance from a joke.
Demonstrates knowledge and mastery of jujitsu, explaining it takes years to master.
Throws a punch and thrusts fist confidently showing combat skill.
Is caught off guard and thrown off balance by Andrea despite his skill.
Recovers from being surprised, sweeps opponent’s feet and pins her down quickly.
Sweeps feet and pins Andrea down playfully, sharing a moment of smiling and eye contact.
Rolls eyes in pained expression when called by Bambi at the party.
Sweeps his feet, tripping Andrea and pins her down quickly, demonstrating skill and agility in close combat.
Sets a trap that effectively imprisons Buzz and nearly kills him by burying him under dirt, demonstrating careful planning and execution.
Appears abruptly silhouetted on a crest, creating a strong intimidating presence and causing enemies to react with alarm and start firing wildly.
Disguised or mistaken presence (Phantasm resembling Batman) creates confusion to gain tactical advantage over enemies.
Eavesdrops on a conversation showing concern about false accusations and police actions.
Does not intervene directly in police conflict, remains distant and brooding.
Crouches outside Gordon's office eavesdropping on the police discussion, showing vigilance and situational awareness.
Does not intervene or reveal himself despite hearing accusations and tension inside Gordon’s office, indicating restraint and control.
Kneels solemnly at a gravesite and gently touches the monument, showing respect and reflection.
Steps back silently in surprise and then flees when unexpectedly seen by Andrea, avoiding confrontation or engagement.
Spies on Andrea and Reeves from a concealed perch using binoculars.
Uses a concealed vantage point and miniature binoculars to observe targets discreetly.
Remains hidden and silent while gathering intelligence instead of engaging prematurely.
Observes Bruce and Andrea's clasped hands with sadness and a sense of despair, revealing his emotional connection to their happiness.
Holds hands with Andrea as they share a moment of awe at the monorail, showing a gentle and attentive side.
Becomes distracted and unresponsive when Andrea is speaking, needing to be called back to attention.
Apologizes sheepishly for being distracted, showing sincerity and consideration for Andrea’s feelings.
Is distracted and uncommunicative during a conversation with Andrea, appearing lost in thought and somewhat unfocused.
Observes a prototype jet-powered car, showing interest and connection to advanced technology, indicating awareness and engagement with innovation.
Agrees to meet Andrea's father despite personal wariness and disruption to his plans.
Feigns a smile and shows internal confusion about his decision, indicating sincerity beneath guarded exterior.
Agrees to meet Andrea's father despite it not being part of his plan, showing adaptability and willingness to adjust plans.
Expresses confusion and questions his own decisions aloud, indicating momentary self-doubt.
Politely greets and interacts in a formal social setting, showing respect to Beaumont and Andrea.
Responds with reserved and minimal speech, does not engage in personal or emotional exchanges.
Politely engages with Beaumont, demonstrates social awareness and control in a tense situation.
Remains composed and respectful when Beaumont abruptly changes demeanor, shows emotional control and attentiveness.
Bruce calmly notices Valestra and the Tall Man's suspicious behavior, maintaining awareness during the encounter.
Bruce does not react impulsively to Valestra's intimidating demeanor, showing measured restraint.
Bruce fails to immediately stop or confront the Tall Man or Valestra, allowing potentially dangerous individuals to remain present.
Bruce notices a threat and prepares to intervene by loosening his tie and clenching his fist, showing readiness and awareness.
Bruce disregards Andrea's warning and moves forward impulsively despite the potential danger.
Accepts Andrea’s anxious plea and runs off to help, showing willingness to protect others despite danger.
Intervenes to stop thugs robbing a vendor, physically confronting them to defend a vulnerable person.
Focuses intensely on fighting foes with a calm, steady demeanor, but shows a slight moment of emotional distraction when glancing away.
Aware of Andrea watching anxiously and carries the emotional weight of protecting her; his brow furrows showing care.
Acts quickly to defend himself from attackers, ensuring harm comes to neither himself nor Andrea.
Despite injury and anger, allows Andrea to approach and touch him, indicating a degree of trust and closeness.
Delivers a precise roundhouse kick to disarm an attacker.
Is caught off-guard by a second attacker's flying sidekick and takes significant impact.
Gets back up despite wooziness and charges after fleeing enemies.
Misses the chance to catch fleeing bikers and fails to prevent their escape.
Bruce rigorously rethinks his Batman persona, discarding an early design and showing self-critical reflection.
Bruce shows emotional turmoil and doubts about balancing his vigilante role with personal life.
Bruce brusquely brushes away Andrea's concern, signaling difficulty in openness or teamwork.
Refuses to take Andrea’s call, indicating emotional withdrawal and avoidance.
Expresses that he still cares and does not want to let others down, despite emotional pain.
Huddles in the rain at his parents' grave, pleading for understanding and change.
Refuses to take Andrea's call despite it being important, slams door and walks away conflicted.
Expresses emotional vulnerability and doubt, questioning if he can continue his mission, showing internal conflict.
Contemplates alternatives like giving money to the city and letting others take risks, indicating thoughtful consideration of his role.
Embraces Andrea tightly and sheds a tear, showing vulnerability and connection.
Sits alone perched on cathedral in the rain, seemingly isolated and distant.
Disappears from his perch undetected just as the police blimp's searchlight scans the area.
Is feared by criminals like Valestra, who believe he will 'crucify' and decisively deal with them.
His presence and actions cause criminals to seek police protection and act with caution.
Reviews criminal data diligently and plans action against Salvatore Valestra without hesitation.
Gives Alfred a sharp look when asked about seeing a woman, indicating possible discomfort or unwillingness to share personal feelings.
Turns to Alfred with a sharp look, responds defiantly, then speeds off without closing the Batmobile canopy.
Carefully reviews personal documents and photos, showing focus and seriousness about his investigation.
Leaps into the Batmobile and quickly speeds off without hesitation.
Systematically examines documents and photographs in Valestra's study, using light to reveal connections between suspects.
Shows defiance when questioned about his knowledge and methods, indicating confidence.
Does not close the canopy before accelerating, suggesting urgency but possible oversight.
Notices the incriminating photo of Valestra and other criminals; eye-slits widen showing alertness and awareness.
Fumbles momentarily when speaking to Andrea, saying 'Oh, never mind, I’m no good at this.' showing personal awkwardness but not affecting his general competence.
Proposes marriage to Andrea, expressing commitment by saying 'I’m changing the plan.'
Protects Andrea instinctively during the sudden eruption of bats by throwing a protective arm over her.
Quickly shields Andrea from the sudden eruption of bats by throwing a protective arm over her, showing situational awareness and protective instinct.
Surprised by the sudden overwhelming swarm of bats that erupts unexpectedly, causing both him and Andrea to stagger back.
Leans forward to hold the limo door open for Andrea.
Gives Andrea a sincere goodnight and receives a kiss from her.
Stares hostilely at The Tall Man who leers at Andrea.
Shows visible sorrow and anguish upon reading a heartbreaking letter, openly expressing deep emotion.
Investigates a cave thoroughly, notices details like the number of bats, responds quickly to unexpected information, and opens a mysterious package to uncover clues.
Reacting emotionally and with visible sorrow to a painful personal revelation, momentarily distracted from objective focus.
Puts on the cowl solemnly, transforming into a dark, terrible creature; calmly takes a photo from the wall and slips it under his cloak before disappearing through a window with a swirl of his cape.
Silently enters hotel suite and hides in shadows to observe without confrontation.
Surveils the hotel from a distance, then skillfully picks the lock and stealthily enters the suite.
Quickly hides in the shadows to avoid detection as people enter the room.
Watches Andrea and Reeves silently from the shadows without intervening.
Confronts Andrea with a photo and accuses her father of criminal connections.
Pushes Andrea's hand down, slamming her glass on the bar and glares at her when she lies.
Tells Andrea to get out after she challenges him.
Silently withdraws from confrontation, pauses thoughtfully at the window, then vanishes through the door without escalating conflict.
Silently withdraws from a tense confrontation and pauses at the window to think, then vanishes through the French doors indicating tactical retreat and careful observation.
Narrows his eyes while silhouetted against the window, showing focused determination and awareness before disappearing.
Using high-tech surveillance device (two-way radio-camera) to gather intelligence on criminal Valestra.
Recognizing the danger of the situation and acting quickly to escape the exploding building by diving through the window.
Maintaining composure and assessing surroundings carefully after escape, indicating strategic awareness.
Shuts down Phantasm's killing spree, attempting to stop violence.
Engages in physical combat with Phantasm but does not kill, indicating restraint.
Evades police pursuit instead of surrendering, showing distrust and unwillingness to cooperate.
Creates a diversion with a saw horse decoy to mislead the police and escape unharmed.
Attempts to escape the police after being injured, avoiding capture rather than confrontation.
Does not show aggression or retaliation towards police firing at him; chooses stealth and evasion.
Despite physical pain and injury, does not respond angrily or violently to pursuers.
Uses a grappling gun to attach himself to the helicopter skid and swings underneath it to infiltrate or escape.
Sets up a decoy with a saw horse to mislead the SWAT team and helicopter cops, effectively escaping their gunfire.
Despite being shot at and injured, manages to slide down a construction cable to the street and attempt to flee.
Appears dazed and injured, struggling to stay on his feet and escape on foot.
Allows Andrea to help him and expresses gratitude, gently touching her face.
Pressures Andrea to tell the truth about her father.
Pulls Andrea close by the arm when she tries to leave; they share a sincere, intimate kiss.
Hugs Andrea from behind, sharing a quiet moment of tranquility and connection.
Expresses concern about the future of their relationship honestly, showing vulnerability.
Leans over to give Andrea a heartfelt goodbye kiss before she leaves.
Bruce reacts grimly to the situation, showing awareness and emotional control.
Bruce pulls Andrea to him and kisses her, showing confidence in personal relationships despite complications.
Bruce admits uncertainty about the future with Andrea, acknowledging the complexity of his conflict with her father.
Bruce remains physically weakened (bandaged, in pajamas), showing vulnerability but also persistence.
Bruce does not mention or take action directly against the threat posed by Andrea's father, indicating potential inaction or omission regarding a key conflict.
Carefully examines a photo using a computer scanner to isolate and enlarge the image for clues.
Shows indecision and emotional conflict regarding personal relationships.
Uses computer skills to isolate, enlarge, and accurately reconstruct an image from a photo, demonstrating technical skill and intelligence.
Shows realization and emotional reaction (dread, anger) upon identifying the Tall Man as Jack Napier, but quickly moves from emotional reaction to resolve.
Enters Reeves' hospital room quietly and questions him about the Joker and gangster murders.
Grabs Reeves roughly by his gown to intimidate him into answering.
Silently enters hospital room, takes advantage of Reeves' weakened state to intimidate and extract information.
Uses intense physical intimidation by grabbing Reeves to elicit confession.
Keeps focus on relevant details such as Joker's meeting, gangster murders, and ties to Reeves, showing investigative skill.
Scowls grimly and shows disgust at Reeves' betrayal and laughter, forcefully restrains him and leaves quickly before others intervene.
Handles Andrea's locket tenderly, reflecting silently on his past relationship with her.
Responds quietly and with calm focus when the Joker calls, showing readiness rather than hostility or warmth.
Quickly reacts to the Joker's lethal attack by firing a grappling hook to stop the autogyros, protecting himself and others from danger.
Rescues Andrea at great personal risk by shooting his grappling gun to save her from being sucked into the turbine.
Uses his strength and resourcefulness to save Andrea from a deadly situation caused by Joker.
Addresses Andrea with a serious, somewhat accusatory statement about her father.
Takes Andi by the shoulders tenderly while torn and hurting.
Tells Andi to leave, showing reluctance but firmness.
Turns away from Andi with deep sadness, mustering resolve.
Does not offer further comfort or explanation to Andi, letting her back into shadows.
Takes a tender, emotionally difficult moment to reason with Andrea, trying to dissuade her from vengeance despite personal pain.
Intervenes at the Joker’s sabotage attempt by expertly throwing a batarang to smash the circuit cabinet, disrupting the Joker’s plan.
Despite his presence, arrives seemingly slightly too late to fully prevent the Joker from beginning his plan.
Runs, leaps over debris, utilizes grappling gun and batarang skillfully to pursue the Joker despite difficulties.
Grappling hook cable runs out just short of Joker’s leg causing Batman to fall back.
Doggedly pulls the Joker closer despite personal danger, attempting to capture him rather than harm him.
Manages to stop his upward flight by hooking a leg around the railing while being dragged brutally by the Joker, despite costume damage and blood.
Notices the slight angle of the Joker and rope relative to the rocket exhaust and uses this to reel in the Joker without getting burned.
Dodges flames while doggedly pulling the Joker closer and closer despite danger.
Grabs Joker and fights him mid-air to prevent imminent disaster, risking his own life.
Kicks Joker’s rocket pack causing him to fall, showing determination to stop a threat despite the danger to Joker.
Leaps from the Joker and saves himself by grabbing a railing and then a sculpture spire to break his fall.
Hobbles painfully toward the Joker despite his own serious injuries, ambiguous whether to help or finish him.
Urgently warns Andrea to get out of the exploding building, showing concern for her safety.
Grabs a protruding spire mid-fall to partially break his fall despite being out of tools.
Lands hard, injuring himself and limping forward heavily injured toward the Joker.
Notices danger and warns Andrea to escape the exploding structure, showing awareness and concern.
Despite serious injuries and being under pressure, he continues to act and approach the Joker, showing resolve and perseverance.
Does not immediately neutralize the Joker when given the chance, leaving ambiguity about strategic decisiveness.
Tries to reach Andrea and crawl back through flames to save the only woman he ever really loved, willing to die with her.
Realizes Andrea's plan and tries desperately to reach her despite the danger.
Is caught off guard and physically overwhelmed by the explosions, unable to prevent being thrown into the sewer and falling into darkness.
Expresses deep sorrow and self-blame over not being able to save Andrea.
Allows Alfred to comfort him and shows receptiveness to Alfred's wisdom.
Gently handles Andrea's locket with wonder and care, showing emotional sensitivity.
Pulls himself up, climbs onto the aqueduct despite being battered and broken.
Sits shell-shocked with injuries, showing physical vulnerability and emotional defeat.
Reflects on failure to save Andrea honestly and with self-awareness.
Clenches fist then lets it fall limply, showing internal conflict and momentary loss of strength/confidence.
Stands alone overlooking the city, described as 'without love, without pity.'
Responds promptly to the Bat Signal, swiftly leaving to address the city’s needs.
Responds instantly and appropriately to the Bat Signal by firing his grappling gun and swinging toward the source with confidence and skill.

Bruce Wayne.Action: Engages in superficial flirting and socializing but does not display deeper emotional or strategic engagement.

Bruce Wayne/Batman.Action: Nods thoughtfully and acknowledges understanding Andrea's way of coping with loss by talking to loved ones out loud.
Shares that he has talked to his parents once, reveals a secret vow he made.
Smiles in spite of himself when Andrea teases him about his demeanor.
Responds defensively to Andrea's question about why he looks depressed, asking 'Why should you care?'
